intro: Echinospermum redowskii var. cupulatum, commonly known as the cupulate echinosperm, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its hairy, glandular leaves. Its fruit is a schizocarp, which splits into two one-seeded parts when mature. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological adaptations.
